oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Is Orbeseal速 the answer to mastitis in organic farms?
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Notz, Christophe
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Dairy cattle
Health and welfare
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In addition to fertility problems mastitis also is a main animal health problem in organic dairy farms. A lot of therapeutics, mostly conventional, are used for this indication. The losses due to lower milk production, cure costs and replacement costs are enormous. Furthermore the regulations for organic farming rather favour complementary therapies than the use of antibiotics or other chemical-synthetic drugs. Consequently the non-antibiotic teat-sealer labelled as Orbeseal速 could be a solution to improve the udder health in organic farming.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Notz, Christophe (2005) Is Orbeseal速 the answer to mastitis in organic farms? Working paper, Tiergesundheit, Forschungsinstitut f端r biologischen Landbau (FiBL), CH-5070 Frick. [Unpublished]
